verses.roman:
pādāv asya vinirbhinnau
lokeśo viṣṇur āviśat
gatyā svāṁśena puruṣo
yayā prāpyaṁ prapadyate

synonyms: pādau—the legs; asya—of the gigantic form; vinirbhinnau—being manifested separately; loka-īśaḥ viṣṇuḥ—the demigod Viṣṇu (not the Personality of Godhead); āviśat—entered; gatyā—by the power of movement; sva-aṁśena—with his own parts; puruṣaḥ—living entity; yayā—by which; prāpyam—destination; prapadyate—reaches.
translation: Thereafter the legs of the gigantic form separately became manifest, and the demigod named Viṣṇu [not the Personality of Godhead] entered with partial movement. This helps the living entity move to his destination.
